wiki.content: "I Shot the Sheriff" is a song written by Bob Marley. The song was first released on The Wailers' album Burnin'. Eric Clapton recorded a cover version that was included on his album, 461 Ocean Boulevard. It is the most successful version of the song, peaking at #1 on the Billboard Hot 100, becoming Clapton's only chart-topping hit in the U.S. I want to say 'I shot the police' but the government would have made a fuss so I said 'I shot the sheriff' instead... but it's the same idea: justice." — Bob Marley During the controversy over the Body Count song "Cop Killer", it was frequently pointed out that there were no similar complaints about Marley's song even though they had similar themes. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "I Shot the Sheriff" is a song written by Bob Marley. The song was first released on The Wailers' album Burnin'. Eric Clapton recorded a cover version that was included on his album, 461 Ocean Boulevard. It is the most successful version of the song, peaking at #1 on the Billboard Hot 100, becoming Clapton's only chart-topping hit in the U.S. I want to say 'I shot the police' but the government would have made a fuss so I said 'I shot the sheriff' instead... but it's the same idea: justice." — Bob Marley

track.name: I Shot The Sheriff
comments: So why did Bob Marley confess to a crime he wasn't charged with? They arrested him for killing the Deputy, a crime he is not guilty of, but he confesses to killing the Sheriff even though he wasn't charged with it.
Why is this only on position 12?

That's the reason why all Policeman are very unkind, about Rasdta people GOTT sei Dank gibt's hier bei uns jetzt viel  nettere Polizisten. Ich habe da Gefühl, die ganze Welt ist besser geworde. Sowas, darf man auch nicht singen!
I shot tha sheriff buh, I didn't shoot the deputy!

Sheriff John Brown always hated me - 
for what I don't know.
Ev'ry time that I plant a seed -
he said "Kill it before it grow."
parisblues, he shot the sheriff, but he didn't shoot no deputy.
what we are suppose to understand in this song ? is someone could explain me the meaning of this song... I tried with translation.. sadly not very well.
